content.question: An increase in taxes on businesses in the United States will likely have what impact on the short-run aggregate supply <math alttext="S R A S" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>SRAS</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>Â curve in the United States?

choices.label: It will cause a movement along the <math alttext="S R A S" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>SRAS</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> curve to a higher real output.
It will cause a movement along the <math alttext="S R A S" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>SRAS</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> curve to a lower real output.
It will have no impact on the <math alttext="S R A S" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>SRAS</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> curve.
It will cause the <math alttext="S R A S" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>SRAS</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> curve to shift leftward.
It will cause the <math alttext="S R A S" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>SRAS</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> curve to shift rightward.

content.answer: It will cause the <math alttext="S R A S" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>SRAS</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> curve to shift leftward.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine the outcome of an economic situation using economic concepts, principles, or models.
